#Libs
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
#Encoders
from sklearn.preprocessing import OrdinalEncoder
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
#XGB & MSE
from xgboost import XGBRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
source.527043ad:
train = pd.read_csv(train_data_file_path)
test = pd.read_csv(test_data_file_path)
sub = pd.read_csv(sub_file_path)
source.5aaa9391:
y = train.target
train.drop(['target', 'id'], axis = 1, inplace = True)
test.drop(['id'], axis = 1, inplace = True)
train.head()
source.e11f7d58:
cat_cols = [col for col in train.columns if 'cat' in col]

X = train.copy()
X_test = test.copy()
enc = OrdinalEncoder()
X[cat_cols] = enc.fit_transform(train[cat_cols])
X_test[cat_cols] = enc.transform(test[cat_cols])
X.head()
source.d071ab08: X_train, X_valid, y_train, y_valid = train_test_split(X, y, test_size = 0.15)
source.13bc506c:
model = XGBRegressor()
model.fit(X_train, y_train)
preds = model.predict(X_valid)
print("RMAE: ", np.sqrt(mean_squared_error(y_valid, preds)))
